page.title: 16Farming in the Langford Area
page.content: There are eight farms in the area and they grow corn and grass and keep dairy and beef herds. Wheat is the main crop of the area. One of the farms has over 580 acres of land. In 1984 the farmer put 400 acres to wheat and barley and 160 acres to grass. The grass was grown and cut for silage and hay. He put 120 acres down for silage and the rest for hay. The grass for silage was put in the clamps covered with black plastic and weighted down with old tyres. The farm produced over 900 tons of grain in 1984. The straw produed over 15,000 bales of straw which was all used by the farmer for his beef and dairy herds.The grain was selling for about 100 pounds a ton.He sells his grain to a Corn Merchant in Calne in Wiltshire.
